snippet: Tom Cutinella of Shoreham-Wading River High School was the third high school football player in the country to die in the past week.
abstract: Tom Cutinella, 16-year-old football player at Shoreham-Wading River High School in Long Island, dies after crashing into another player; becomes third high school football player in the country to die in a single week; death comes at time when football has drawn increased scrutiny amid concerns about injuries and brain damage.

byline.original: By MARY PILON, STEVE EDER and MATT KRUPNICK
byline.contributor: Mary Pilon and Steve Eder reported from New York, and Matt Krupnick from Shoreham, N.Y. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Tom Cutinella of Shoreham-Wading River High School was the third high school football player in the country to die in the past week.

headline.main: In Death of Long Island High School Player, Perils of Football Reverberate
headline.print_headline: In Death of L.I. High School Player, Perils of a Sport Reverberate
